Functions

retrieveAllEntriesForFeed( object   $feed, ) : mixed

Description

Retrieve all entries for a feed, iterating through pages as necessary.

Be aware that calling this function on a large dataset will take a significant amount of time to complete. In some cases this may cause execution to timeout without proper precautions in place.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$feed object | The feed to iterate through.

Return value

Type Description
mixed A new feed of the same type as the one originally passed in, containing all relevent entries.

enableRequestDebugLogging( string   $logfile, ) : n/a

Description

This method enables logging of requests by changing the Zend_Http_Client_Adapter used for performing the requests.

NOTE: This will not work if you have customized the adapter already to use a proxy server or other interface.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$logfile string | The logfile to use when logging the requests

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

getNextFeed( Zend_Gdata_App_Feed   $feed, string   $className = null, ) : Zend_Gdata_App_Feed|null

Description

Retrieve next set of results based on a given feed.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$feed Zend_Gdata_App_Feed | The feed from which to retreive the next set of results.
$className string | (optional) The class of feed to be returned. If null, the next feed (if found) will be the same class as the feed that was given as the first argument. null

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_App_Feed|null Returns a Zend_Gdata_App_Feed or null if no next set of results exists.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_App_Feed|null Returns a Zend_Gdata_App_Feed or null if no previous set of results exists.

generateIfMatchHeaderData(   $data,   $allowWeek, ) : string|null

Description

Returns the data for an If-Match header based on the current Etag property. If Etags are not supported by the server or cannot be extracted from the data, then null will be returned.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$data n/a
$allowWeek n/a

Return value

Type Description
string|null $data

Zend_Gdata_App

http://framework.zend.com/license/new-bsd New BSD License  
Zend_Gdata  
App  
No 
No 

Description

Provides Atom Publishing Protocol (APP) functionality. This class and all other components of Zend_Gdata_App are designed to work independently from other Zend_Gdata components in order to interact with generic APP services.

Methods

__call, __construct, delete, get, getEntry, getFeed, getGzipEnabled, getHttpClient, getHttpMethodOverride, getMajorProtocolVersion, getMaxRedirects, getMinorProtocolVersion, getStaticHttpClient, getVerboseExceptionMessages, import, importFile, importString, importUrl, insertEntry, performHttpRequest, post, prepareRequest, put, registerPackage, setGzipEnabled, setHttpClient, setHttpMethodOverride, setMajorProtocolVersion, setMaxRedirects, setMinorProtocolVersion, setStaticHttpClient, setVerboseExceptionMessages, updateEntry,

__call( string   $method, array   $args, ) : n/a

Description

Provides a magic factory method to instantiate new objects with shorter syntax than would otherwise be required by the Zend Framework naming conventions. For instance, to construct a new Zend_Gdata_Calendar_Extension_Color, a developer simply needs to do $gCal->newColor(). For this magic constructor, packages are searched in the same order as which they appear in the $_registeredPackages array

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$method string | The method name being called
$args array | The arguments passed to the call

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_Exception

prepareRequest( string   $method, string   $url = null, array   $headers = array, mixed   $data = null, string   $contentTypeOverride = null, ) : array

Description

Provides pre-processing for HTTP requests to APP services.
  1. Checks the $data element and, if it's an entry, extracts the XML, multipart data, edit link (PUT,DELETE), etc.
  2. If $data is a string, sets the default content-type header as 'application/atom+xml' if it's not already been set.
  3. Adds a x-http-method override header and changes the HTTP method to 'POST' if necessary as per getHttpMethodOverride()

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$method string | The HTTP method for the request - 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE'
$url string | The URL to which this request is being performed, or null if found in $data null
$headers array | An associative array of HTTP headers for this request array
$data mixed | The Zend_Gdata_App_Entry or XML for the body of the request null
$contentTypeOverride string | The override value for the content type of the request body null

Return value

Type Description
array An associative array containing the determined &#039;method&#039;, &#039;url&#039;, &#039;data&#039;, &#039;headers&#039;, &#039;contentType&#039;

setHttpMethodOverride( boolean   $override = true, ) : void

Description

Toggle using POST instead of PUT and DELETE HTTP methods

Some feed implementations do not accept PUT and DELETE HTTP methods, or they can't be used because of proxies or other measures. This allows turning on using POST where PUT and DELETE would normally be used; in addition, an X-Method-Override header will be sent with a value of PUT or DELETE as appropriate.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$override boolean | Whether to override PUT and DELETE with POST. true

Return value

Type Description
void

Description

setMinorProtocolVersion( (int|NULL)   $value, ) : n/a

Description

updateEntry( mixed   $data, string|null   $uri = null, string|null   $className = null, array   $extraHeaders = array, ) : Zend_Gdata_App_Entry

Description

Update an entry

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$data mixed | Zend_Gdata_App_Entry or XML (w/ID and link rel='edit')
$uri string | null | The URI to send requests to, or null if $data contains the URI. null
$className string | null | The name of the class that should be deserialized from the server response. If null, then 'Zend_Gdata_App_Entry' will be used. null
$extraHeaders array | Extra headers to add to the request, as an array of string-based key/value pairs. array

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_App_Entry The entry returned from the server

  protected  $_defaultPostUri = null

Default URI to which to POST.string


  protected  static $_gzipEnabled = false

Enable gzipped responses?boolean


  protected  $_httpClient =

Client object used to communicateZend_Http_Client


  protected  static $_httpMethodOverride = false

Override HTTP PUT and DELETE request methods?boolean


  protected  $_majorProtocolVersion =

Indicates the major protocol version that should be used.
<p>At present, recognized values are either 1 or 2. However, any integer value >= 1 is considered valid.</p> <p>Under most circumtances, this will be automatically set by Zend_Gdata_App subclasses.</p>

  protected  static $_maxRedirects = 5

Maximum number of redirects to follow during HTTP operationsint


  protected  $_minorProtocolVersion =

Indicates the minor protocol version that should be used. Can be set to either an integer >= 0, or NULL if no minor version should be sent to the server.
<p>At present, this field is not used by any Google services, but may be used in the future.</p> <p>Under most circumtances, this will be automatically set by Zend_Gdata_App subclasses.</p>

  protected  $_registeredPackages = array

Packages to search for classes when using magic __call method, in order.array


  protected  static $_staticHttpClient = null

Client object used to communicate in static contextZend_Http_Client


  protected  $_useObjectMapping = true

Whether we want to use XML to object mapping when fetching data.boolean


  protected  static $_verboseExceptionMessages = true

Use verbose exception messages. In the case of HTTP errors, use the body of the HTTP response in the exception message.boolean
